me.pagekite.glen3b.library.bukkit.menu.inventory

Class CyclingInventoryMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.pagekite.glen3b.library.bukkit.menu.inventory.InventoryMenu
      • me.pagekite.glen3b.library.bukkit.menu.inventory.CyclingInventoryMenu
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.bukkit.event.Listener

    public class CyclingInventoryMenu
extends InventoryMenu
    Creates an inventory that acts as a menu. The items in this inventory will "cycle" through various choices.
    Author:
    nisovin (original code), Glen Husman

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description

      A class for the creation of cycling inventory menus.
      protected class  CyclingInventoryMenu.ItemCycler
      Runnable that cycles through items at a specified index.

      • CyclingInventoryMenu

        public CyclingInventoryMenu(java.lang.String name,
                    int size)
        Creates an inventory menu.
        Parameters:
        name - The color formatted name of the menu. This value is assumed to be unique when determining if a clicked inventory was this inventory.
        size - The size of the inventory, which must be a multiple of 9.

      • isSchedulerOptimizationEnabled

        public boolean isSchedulerOptimizationEnabled()
        Determines whether cycler slot scheduling optimization is enabled. Optimization is defined as not scheduling cycler tasks if the array size is one. The default value of this is true.
        Returns:
        A boolean representing the presence value of scheduler cycling.
        See Also:
        setSchedulerOptimizationEnabled(boolean)

      • setSchedulerOptimizationEnabled

        public void setSchedulerOptimizationEnabled(boolean value)
        Sets the enabled status of scheduler optimization. The only reason this should ever be set to false is if an item element at a given slot does not cycle, but its value may change at runtime during inventory viewing (and the user will want to see this change). With the optimizer enabled, the change from a single cycle item to another single cycle item will not be viewed by the user. However, without the optimizer enabled, the user will see the change as soon as the cycler delay for that slot has elapsed.
        Parameters:
        value - The new status of cycler scheduling optimization.
        See Also:
        isSchedulerOptimizationEnabled()

             org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack icon,
             java.lang.String name,
             java.lang.String... info)
        Sets the option at the specified position to the specified item. The item will have the specified name and lore.
        Overrides:
        setOption in class InventoryMenu
        Parameters:
        position - The zero-based index of the item.
        icon - The item itself to use.
        name - The color-formatted name of the item.
        info - The color-formatted lore of the item.

      • setOption

        public void setOption(int position,
             org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack[] icons,
             long cycleDelay)
        Sets the option at the specified position to the specified item. The items will have no ItemMeta modified.
        Parameters:
        position - The zero-based index of the item.
        icons - The items to use.
        cycleDelay - The time between cycling through items, in server ticks.

      • setOption

        public void setOption(int position,
             org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack[] icons,
             java.lang.String name,
             long cycleDelay)
        Sets the option at the specified position to the specified item. The items will have their display name modified.
        Parameters:
        position - The zero-based index of the item.
        icons - The items to use.
        name - The color-formatted name of the item. This name will override all provided names. If it is null, the names will remain unchanged.
        cycleDelay - The time between cycling through items, in server ticks.
